definition[0]: a product etc that is the most basic or simple of its kind, making it suitable for people who do not have much money to spend or who do not have experience using the product
example[0]: They have added an entry-level machine, complementing their existing range of computers.
definition[1]: a job etc at the lowest level in a company, profession, trade etc
example[1]: We need to create more entry-level jobs for people with the fewest job skills who need opportunities the most.
definition[2]: the level at which someone who has little or no experience of working enters a company or organization at the start of their career
example[2]: He was told that he would be paid $5 to $7 an hour at entry level.
